Issues.Title: fix(ngcc): use aliased exported types correctly
Issues.Body:
If a type has been renamed when it was exported, we need to
reference the external public alias name rather than the internal
original name for the type. Otherwise we will try to import the
type by its internal name, which is not publicly accessible.

Fixes #38238
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ngcc): use aliased exported types correctly" (#38666)

Issues.Title: Angular language-service intellisense add keyof autocomplete
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/language-service


### Description
A property of type keyof anyInterface when used will not display those keys inside html or inline html.


### Describe the solution you'd like
Property representing a keyof interface should give the user a list of the properties while activating intellisense inside the parameter value in the .html file or inline html.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
It's possible to use an enum but they have to be defined inside the ts file first.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular language-service intellisense add keyof autocomplete" (#38663)

Issues.Title: fix(core): reset `tView` between tests in Ivy TestBed
Issues.Body:
`tView` that is stored on a component def contains information about directives and pipes that are available in the scope of this component. Patching component scope causes `tView` to be updated. Prior to this commit, the `tView` information was not restored/reset in case component class is not declared in the `declarations` field while calling `TestBed.configureTestingModule`, thus causing `tView` to be reused between tests (thus preserving scopes information between tests). This commit updates TestBed logic to preserve `tView` value before applying scope changes and reset it back to the previous state between tests.

Closes #38600.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

Issues.Title: feat(dev-infra): tool for staging and publishing releases
Issues.Body:
Creates a tool for staging and publishing releases as per the
new branching and versioning that has been outlined in the following
document. The tool is intended to be used across the organization to
ensure consistent branching/versioning and labeling:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/197kVillDwx-RZtSVOBtPb4BBIAw0E9RT3q3v6DZkykU

The tool implements the actions as outlined in the following
initial plan: https://hackmd.io/2Le8leq0S6G_R5VEVTNK9A.

The implementation slightly divered in so far that it performs
staging and publishing together so that releasing is a single
convenient command. In case of errors for which re-running the
full command is not sufficient, we want to consider adding
recover functionality. e.g. when the staging completed, but the
actual NPM publishing aborted unexpectedly due to build errors.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(dev-infra): tool for staging and publishing releases" (#38656)

Issues.Title: Unsubscribing interval outside of fakeAsync call leads 1 periodic timer(s) still in the queue.
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/core/testing ### Is this a regression? Dunno ### Description If interval was created in one fakeAsync call and is unsubscribed in another (or without one) then test fails with `Error: 1 periodic timer(s) still in the queue.`. Same with unfinished timeout. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ```ts import { fakeAsync } from '@angular/core/testing'; import { interval, Subject } from 'rxjs'; import { takeUntil } from 'rxjs/operators'; describe('fakeAsync + interval', () => { const subscribeMock = jasmine.createSpy(); const interval$ = interval(1000); const destroyed = new Subject(); beforeEach(fakeAsync(() => { interval$.pipe(takeUntil(destroyed)).subscribe(subscribeMock); })); afterEach(() => { destroyed.next(); }); it('smth', () => { expect(subscribeMock).not.toHaveBeenCalled(); }); }); ``` Adding fakeAsync calls to afterEach/it don't help. It passes only like this ```ts it('smth', fakeAsync(() => { interval$.pipe(takeUntil(destroyed)).subscribe(subscribeMock); expect(1).toEqual(1); destroyed.next(); })); ``` (fakeAsync is used due to tick usage in real tests) ## üî• Exception or Error 

Error: 1 periodic timer(s) still in the queue
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

yarn run v1.16.0
$ ng version

Issues.Title: bug(core): viewRef._viewContainerRef can leak memory (ViewRef, ViewContainerRef)
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages as the source of the bug? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> The issue is caused by package @angular/core


### Is this a regression?

This is a problem in Ivy and View Engine.


### Description

The `attachToViewContainerRef()` method of the `ViewRef` class is called whenever the `ViewRef` is attached to a `ViewContainerRef`, and this `ViewContainerRef` instance is assigned to `viewRef._viewContainerRef`.

https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/930eeaf177a4c277f437f42314605ff8dc56fc82/packages/core/src/render3/view_ref.ts#L284-L289

The **only** place where the `_viewContainerRef` property is cleared is when `viewRef.destroy()` is manually called.

https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/930eeaf177a4c277f437f42314605ff8dc56fc82/packages/core/src/render3/view_ref.ts#L75-L88

When `viewContainerRef.detach()` is used to detach a `ViewRef`, the `_viewContainerRef` property is still referencing the container from which it was detached. If this container should be destroyed (e.g. a `ViewContainerRef` of a component being destroyed), then the `_viewContainerRef` property will continue to hold a reference to the destroyed container, causing a memory leak (until the next time this `ViewRef` is attached to a different container).

----

Upon initial glance of the source code, I was not able to find a quick solution to this issue. I don't know if there is a way to access a `ViewRef` instance inside the node_manipulation `detachView()` function.

https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/930eeaf177a4c277f437f42314605ff8dc56fc82/packages/core/src/render3/node_manipulation.ts#L319

Essentially, there needs to be some type of `detachFromViewContainerRef()` method to complement the `attachToViewContainerRef()` method.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

[StackBlitz example](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ymlxv8?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts)
What's happening here:
1. Manually create an `EmbeddedViewRef`.
2. Manually create a dynamic component.
3. Attach the `EmbeddedViewRef` to the dynamic component's `ViewContainerRef`.
4. Detach the `EmbeddedViewRef`.
5. Destroy the dynamic component.

----

(Using Chrome DevTools)
- Load the StackBlitz example.
- Take heap snapshot before doing anything.
	- Search objects for `ViewContainerRef` and you'll find **two** instances.
- Click "create and attach" button.
- Take heap snapshot.
	- Search objects for `ViewContainerRef` and you'll find **three** instances.
- Click "detach and destroy" button.
- Take heap snapshot.
	- Search objects for `ViewContainerRef` and you'll find **three** instances.
	- MEMORY LEAK --> the third `ViewContainerRef` should be garbage collected, as there are no references to it being held in user code

Now uncomment line 35 in app.component.ts that manually clears the `_viewContainerRef` property on `ViewRef` detach:

```ts
// Manually clear the view ref's assigned previously assigned view container
// --> Allows the `viewContainerRef` to be garbage collected.
(this.viewRef as any)._viewContainerRef = null;
```

Do the same steps as above.
After clicking on "detach and destroy", there will only be **two** `ViewContainerRef` instances which is expected behavior.


## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**
10.0.14
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(core): viewRef._viewContainerRef can leak memory (ViewRef, ViewContainerRef)" (#38648)

Issues.Title: fix(compiler-cli): output source-mappings for localized strings
Issues.Body:
Previously, localized strings had very limited or incorrect source-mapping
information available.

Now the i18n AST nodes and related output AST nodes include source-span
information about message-parts and placeholders - including closing tag
placeholders.

This information is then used when generating the final localized string
ASTs to ensure that the correct source-mapping is rendered.

See #38588 (comment)

Issues.Title: [BUG]: Regression build after upgrade to Angular 10 (Module not found: Error: Recursion in resolving)
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/cli ### Is this a regression? Yes, because our projects with Angular 8, 9 correct works ### Description We use a shared directory to node modules on disk (for improved sharing space on CI). .yarnrc (for our ng8, ng9 apps) ``` --modules-folder /var/tmp/yarn/ng10/node_modules/ --cache-folder /var/tmp/yarn/cache/ ``` Therefore, we refer to modules via a symlink: package.json (for our ng8, ng9 apps) ```json "scripts": { "preinstall": "mkdir -p /var/tmp/yarn/ng10/node_modules/ && rm -f node_modules", "postinstall": "ln -s /var/tmp/yarn/ng10/node_modules/ node_modules && yarn ngcc --async" } ``` But after upgrade to Angular 10, everything stop working. Now it is required that the node_modules directory was created locally. Is this a bug angular compiler? ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/splincode/ng-10-build-failed ```bash git clone https://github.com/splincode/ng-10-build-failed.git cd ng-10-build-failed ``` ```bash yarn install yarn build # not working ``` ## üî• Exception or Error 

$ ng build --prod

ERROR in /private/var/tmp/yarn/ng10/node_modules/@angular/common/fesm2015/common.js
Module not found: Error: Recursion in resolving
Stack:
  resolve: (/private/var/tmp/yarn/ng10/node_modules/@angular/common/fesm2015) @angular/core
  newResolve: (/private/var/tmp/yarn/ng10/node_modules/@angular/common/fesm2015) @angular/core
  parsedResolve: (/private/var/tmp/yarn/ng10/node_modules/@angular/common/fesm2015) @angular/core module
  describedResolve: (/private/var/tmp/yarn/ng10/node_modules/@angular/common/fesm2015) @angular/core module
  rawModule: (/private/var/tmp/yarn/ng10/node_modules/@angular/common/fesm2015) @angular/core

Issues.Title: CSS optimization breaks when :host-context is included
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: .... ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... I have a CSS file that is shared between two components, one that uses default encapsulation and one that uses NONE. I have two lines in the CSS as follows: ``` .darkMode .myLogo { color: white; } :host-context(.darkMode) .myLogo { color: white; } ``` This works fine with dev/unoptimized builds. However, when done with a prod/optimized build the resulting CSS combines the two selectors: ``` .darkMode .myLogo,:host-context(.darkMode) .myLogo{color:white}``` The selector is essentially ignored by the browser. For the component using default encapsulation it similarly works fine regardless of whether optimized or not. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ## üî• Exception or Error
## üåç Your Environment 



Angular CLI: 10.0.8
node: 10.16.3
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 10.0.14
**Anything else relevant?** All that I've tried exhibit same issue. no.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CSS optimization breaks when :host-context is included" (#18672)

### Description

Upon upgrading from angular 7 to 10,
The build process doesn't convert image urls to  inline base64 anymore.
That's really not a problem if the default now is to the image url stay as is, but the documentation doesn't show any option in angular.json / ng build flags to turn this feature on again.

Example:

`body.login-page:not(.dashboard-pages) {

    background-repeat: no-repeat;
    background-attachment: fixed;

    width: 650px;
    margin: 7% auto;

}`

This feature is really important to us and hold the angular upgrade, hope there's a configuration to enable this again.

Thanks

Issues.Title: bug(icon): custom directive cannot set svgIcon for mat-icon
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

_`svgIcon` does not seem to work with Stackblitz, providing repo instead._

Steps to reproduce:
1. Clone https://github.com/klemenoslaj/mat-icon-svg-not-applied
2. Install dependencies using `yarn`
3. Execute `ng serve`
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

I tried to create a custom directive that would programmatically assign some icon name to the `svgIcon` input of `mat-icon`, depending on some global icon mapping configuration.
This normally works for any component and I'd expect it should for `mat-icon` too.

Example:
```html
<mat-icon [iconFor]="object"></mat-icon>
```

```ts
@Directive({
  selector: 'mat-icon[iconFor]',
})
export class IconForDirective {
  @Input()
  set iconFor(obj: SomeInterface) {
    this._matIcon.svgIcon = _iconMap[obj.type];
  }

  constructor(
    @Inject(ICON_MAPPING_TOKEN)
    private readonly _iconMap: SomeIconMapping,
    private readonly _matIcon: MatIcon,
  ) {}
}
```

#### Actual Behavior

The behavior described above does not work with `mat-icon`, because the relevant logic is in `ngOnChanges` hook of `mat-icon`, which does not get triggered, unless at least one `Input` is present on the host component.

https://github.com/angular/components/blob/4f1238f84791f4193b5dfc8d9cbef76f04ee36d6/src/material/icon/icon.ts#L229-L264

##### Workaround (ugly):

Instead of
```html
<mat-icon [iconFor]="object"></mat-icon>
```

add dummy/empty `svgIcon`
```html
<mat-icon [iconFor]="object" svgIcon></mat-icon>
```

#### Environment

- Angular: 10.0.14
- CDK/Material: 10.1.3
- Browser(s): any
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): any

---

NOTE: I can submit the PR for this, but would like some thoughts on that, maybe it's expected like this for some reason.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(icon): custom directive cannot set svgIcon for mat-icon" (#20470)

Fixes #10924

Issues.Title: perf(cdk/testing): allow batching of change detection
Issues.Body:
This PR introduces a new API for batching change detection across multiple harness operations. It will run change detection once at the beginning and once at the end of the batch rather than before every read from an element and after every interaction. This results in significant performance gains in some circumstances. For example:
- finding a button by text on a page with 100 buttons: 1250.7ms => 131.8ms (89% improvement)
- clicking 1000 buttons: 3009.8ms => 757.8ms (75% improvement)

Open questions:
- What should we call the method? `batchCD` is just intended as a placeholder name
- I think this function will often be used together with `Promise.all`, should we create a shortcut method for that, e.g. `harness.parallel(() => ...)` === `harness.batchCD(() => Promise.all(() => ...))`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(cdk/testing): allow batching of change detection" (#20464)

Issues.Title: refactor(chips): remove deprecated APIs for v11
Issues.Body:
Removes the APIs that were marked for deprecation in v11. I also decided to un-deprecate making the `animationMode` parameters required, because there's no good reason for them to be mandatory.

BREAKING CHANGES:
* `_changeDetectorRef` and `_document` parameters of the `MatChip` constructor are now required. Also the order of some constructor parameters has changed.
* `elementRef` parameter of the `MatChipRemove` constructor is now required.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(chips): remove deprecated APIs for v11" (#20463)

2. See the loading message / errors in console.
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

To see the API docs

#### Actual Behavior

Loading message stays up. Errors in console. Loading message is never replaced.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug at: https://material.angular.io/components/stepper/api" (#20457)

Issues.Title: refactor(stepper): remove deprecated APIs for v11
Issues.Body:
Removes the APIs that have been marked for removal in v11.

BREAKING CHANGES:
* `MAT_STEPPER_GLOBAL_OPTIONS` has been renamed to `STEPPER_GLOBAL_OPTIONS`.
* The type of `CdkStepper._stepHeader` has been changed to `QueryList<CdkStepHeader>` from `QueryList<FocusableOption>` to better reflect the actual value.
* The value of `CdkStepper.selected` can now be `undefined`.
* The `_elementRef` and `_document` parameters of the `CdkStepper` constructor are now required.
* The `_elementRef` and `_document` parameters of the `MatVerticalStepper` constructor are now required.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(stepper): remove deprecated APIs for v11" (#20456)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-datepicker): Input pattern is ignored.
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

StackBlitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-1v5vvr-monz1x?file=src/app/datepicker-filter-example.html

Steps to reproduce:
1. Add the datepicker
2. Add **any** pattern validation on the input field
4. Observe inputModel.valid somehow
5. valid starts out as false, change the date in the datepicker and it will always be true even if the provided pattern in step 2 doesn't match. 
 
#### Expected Behavior

I would expect the pattern to be validated and the result of it to be put into inputModel.valid


#### Actual Behavior

The pattern is ignored and the value of inputModel.valid is always true.


#### Environment

- Angular: 10
- CDK/Material: 10
- Browser(s): Chrome, Chromium, Edge (chromium based), Firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows and Arch Linux
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(mat-datepicker): Input pattern is ignored." (#20446)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-menu): Smooth dropdown animation only works for first click only
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create basic mat-menu following the official documentation
2. Click on menu trigger button
3. Click outside of menu options or lists
4. Click on menu trigger button again then it loses the smooth animation and just pop those options 
 
This issue is also visible on the official https://material.angular.io/ page too. 

#### Expected Behavior
Whenever there's a click on `menu-trigger` button, `mat-menu` options or lists should be animated smoothly than just popped on screen. This behavior works fabulously in `mat-select` component.


#### Actual Behavior

Smooth animation works only for the first click on `menu trigger button` then it loses the smooth animation and just pop menu content.


#### Environment

- Angular: Angular 10.0.9
- CDK/Material: 10.1.3
- Browser(s): Mozila Firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Win 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(mat-menu): Smooth dropdown animation only works for first click only" (#20451)

Issues.Title: refactor(cdk/scrolling): remove deprecated APIs for v11
Issues.Body:
BREAKING CHANGES:
* The `document` parameter of the `ScrollDispatcher` constructor is now required.
* The `document` parameter of the `ViewportRuler` constructor is now required.
* The `viewportRuler` parameter of the `CdkVirtualScrollViewport` constructor is now required.

Also bumps two autocomplete APIs that were only marked as deprecated 10 days ago to v12 instead of v11.

Issues.Title: bug(MatExpansionPanelHeader): Component visibly resizes after initialization
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://components-issue-asfxnf.stackblitz.io

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create component containing a mat-expansion-panel with a mat-expansion-panel-header
2. Set collapsedHeight to 20px.
3. Load the component in your angular app.
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
The panel should appear collapsed, with a header height of 20px.

#### Actual Behavior

The panel was initially rendered at a larger height, and then shrunk to 20px.

- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS

Issues.Title: refactor(datepicker): remove deprecated APIs for v11
Issues.Body:
Removes the APIs that were marked as deprecated for v11 in the datepicker module.

BREAKING CHANGES:
* The value emitted by `MatCalendar.selectedChange` can now be null.
* `MatDatepickerInput.getPopupConnectionElementRef` has been removed. Use `getConnectedOverlayOrigin` instead.
* The `_changeDetectorRef`, `_model`, `_dateAdapter` and `_rangeSelectionStrategy` parameters of the `MatDatepickerContent` constructor are now required.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(datepicker): remove deprecated APIs for v11" (#20449)

Issues.Title: bug(Sidenav): Using scrollIntoView() with multiple sidenavs
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://angular-9-multiple-sidenav-scrollintoview-issue-1.stackblitz.io

Steps to reproduce:
1. Close Sidenav 2 by clicking toggle button
2. Run the following in browsers console: document.getElementsByClassName('mat-drawer-content')[0].scrollIntoView()
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

In this example nothing should happen.

Note: The scrollIntoView function works as intended. In this example nothing happens since content is too small to make page scrollable.


#### Actual Behavior

Entire page slides left. Notice how Sidenav 1 disappears.
To better visualize the issue, you can at this point toggle sidenav 1. Button for sidenav 1 will no slide left out of view.

#### Environment

- Angular: 9
- CDK/Material: 9.0.1
- Browser(s): IE 11
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): WIndows

#### Other Notes

This issue ONLY happens when Sidenav 2 is closed.
There is no issue if Sidenav 1 is closed, or both sidenavs is closed or opened.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Sidenav): Using scrollIntoView() with multiple sidenavs" (#20447)
